definition: stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: The stagnant global economy will dent China's export growth for years to come.
sentences.chinese: 停滯不前的全球經濟將削弱中國未來幾年的出口增長。

sentences.english: Because commercial pattern is pendent , all jobs backwater not before.
sentences.chinese: 由於商業模式懸而未決，所有的工作都停滯不前。

sentences.english: And in Japan, a young man (Masi Oka, NBC's " Scrubs ") develops a way to stop time through sheer will power.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，一個年輕人集中精力竟可以使時間停滯不前。

sentences.english: During this era, new development of the Financial District had stagnated .
sentences.chinese: 在這個時代，新發展的金融區已停滯不前。

sentences.english: What can I say to you ones that will enable you to comprehend that time never stands still.
sentences.chinese: 我如何表述才能夠令你們理解，時間永不會停滯不前。

sentences.english: The ancient civilization became a byword for isolation and stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 閉關鎖國，停滯不前成了這個文明古國的代名詞。

sentences.english: But isolation does not mean Chinese television is stagnating.
sentences.chinese: 但是，隔離並不意味着中國的電視業是停滯不前的。

sentences.english: Then there are times when we stagnate.
sentences.chinese: 然而有的時候，我們會停滯不前。

sentences.english: If you stand still, you'll quickly fall behind.
sentences.chinese: 如果你停滯不前，你很快就會掉隊。

sentences.english: If you aren't building towards something , you're probably stagnating .
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有努力的目標，你可能會停滯不前。

sentences.english: The war stagnated researches into the causes of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 那場戰爭使癌症起因的研究工作停滯不前。

sentences.english: Have you been in stagnancy before and how did you deal with it?
sentences.chinese: 你之前是否處於停滯不前，你是怎麼處理的？

sentences.english: Risk can be paralyzing for most teams.
sentences.chinese: 風險會使大多數團隊停滯不前。

sentences.english: No one wants this momentum to stall.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人希望這一勢頭停滯不前。

sentences.english: Its economy is strained; witness the ever feebler dollar.
sentences.chinese: 經濟停滯不前，美元的虛弱就是明證。

sentences.english: Nearly half of Gen-Xers feel stalled in their careers, the study says.
sentences.chinese: 該研究稱，近半數的X世代感到在事業上停滯不前。

definition: to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
employee/person employed in a trade or profession
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
